name: TheAtlantic
text: Endia Beal’s photographs explore how race, gender, and work intersect, with a particular focus on the lives of Black women, @imaniperry writes. https://t.co/wKdmudywQw

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @mckaycoppins: Teens did better than expected during this year's quarantine. Some of reasons: more family time, more sleep, less social media. Read @jean_twenge: https://t.co/eFlnlP3WhP

text: "What makes Barrett unpredictable is the possibility that she will interpret God as speaking in ways that she, and the broader conservative world, might not have anticipated," @tanyaluhrmann writes: https://t.co/WzyxSGXSkS

name: TheAtlantic
text: Teens fared better than expected during this year's quarantine, in part because because they got more sleep and family time, writes @jean_twenge. https://t.co/dd0IgQ6nXA

name: TheAtlantic
text: Nikon has announced the winners of the 2020 Small World Photomicrography Competition, which invites photographers and scientists to submit images of all things visible under a microscope—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/NKukf4Chw8

name: TheAtlantic
text: If intellectual meandering is key to real learning, why not embrace distraction—even in class? @lilyjmeyer considers the pandemic-era lecture: https://t.co/PHBcTUjdln
